description: The noun is derived from stock (“supply of anything ready for use”) +‎ pile (“mass of things heaped together”).
The verb is derived from the noun.

definitionGroups.group: A supply (especially a large one) of something kept for future use, specifically in case the cost of the item increases or if there a shortage.

entries.meaning: (specifically, military, weaponry) A supply of nuclear weapons kept by a country; a nuclear stockpile.
(mining) A pile of coal or ore heaped up on the ground after it has been mined.

verbs.description: stockpile (third-person singular simple present stockpiles, present participle stockpiling, simple past and past participle stockpiled) (originally US, also figuratively)

entries.meaning: To accumulate or build up a supply of (something).
(specifically, military, weaponry) To build up a stock of (nuclear weapons).
(mining) To heap up piles of (coal or ore) on the ground after it has been mined.
(intransitive) To build up a supply; to accumulate.
